alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 2:52AM EST until January 30 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oglethorpe and Oconee Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 13.7 feet and nearly steady. - Forecast...Due to additional rain expected through Saturday, the river will remain near 13 feet through Monday and then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
